name: messageheader-response-request
title: MessageHeader response request
publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - InM Work Group
description: This extension enables the capability currently available through MSH-16 (Application Level acknowledgement) in HL7 Version 2 to declare at a message instance level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.

element.definition: This extension enables the capability currently available through MSH-16 (Application Level acknowledgement) in HL7 Version 2 to declare at a message instance level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.
element.comment: The Message Definition data provides perhaps what would be acceptable response requests, but could not indicate for each instance what is appropriate.  The initiator should be able to handle the response even if not expected.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

binding.description: HL7-defined table of codes which identify conditions under which acknowledgments are required to be returned in response to a message.

element.definition: This extension enables the capability currently available through MSH-16 (Application Level acknowledgement) in HL7 Version 2 to declare at a message instance level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.
element.comment: The Message Definition data provides perhaps what would be acceptable response requests, but could not indicate for each instance what is appropriate.  The initiator should be able to handle the response even if not expected.
